basic.description: The course will introduce students to health promotion and health protection strategies at various levels, including the individual, community, region and nation. Examples will be drawn from chronic disease and injury prevention, reproductive and child health, infectious disease prevention and control, and environmental health.Students will also be introduced to the role of surveillance in determining public health priorities.Three term hours; fall every year. K. O¿Connor
basic.subject: EPID
basic.title: Fdtns. Of Pub. Hlth Practice
